Posts.Content: Hi Londonlass I am due for mastectomy at the end of Jan followed by some nodes removal. I am reading lots of useful stuff here and trying to benefit from other's experiences.Â  May I ask what is cording? and how does it occur? The thought of getting lymphoedema scares me. I was so glad to get through FEC-T chemo and now psyching myself up for surgery and RT. I was looking fwd to finishing all treatments and get back to my old life. But after reading about lymphoedema, I started to believe that cancer will change my life forever if I focus on it and other things that can happen. However, I will not let cancer do that. I will have to be more careful and observant of course but determined to stay living an active life and stay hopeful and positive. Good luck to us all and to those looking after cancer patients. Keep focusing on that light at the end of the tunnel.
Posts.Title: Help - I've developed cording

Posts.Content: Hi ladies...i guess i got lucky bec i did not even bother looking for these pre op but on day of my mastectomy, the bra lady came to measure me and gave me 2 temp mastectomy bra and said to contact her in 2 months to get my permanent ones. All free just like my wig. Do we not all get free ones? I just wonder. This same bra and wig lady has an office in same bldg as the breast unit in my hosp.
Posts.Title: Vat and bras
